intro: Tibetoseris depressa, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet and neighboring areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with a distinctive bell-shaped appearance, and it produces small, elongated seeds. Tibetoseris depressa plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to extreme climates.
